Demo Hong Kong Bikin Investor Lari ke Singapura
04 Nov 2019, 07:11 by Ignacio Geordi Oswaldo


Foto: AP Photo/Vincent Yu

Jakarta - Perusahaan manajemen aset J.P. Morgan mengatakan bahwa setoran deposit valuta asing ke bank-bank Singapura telah meningkat pesat dalam beberapa bulan terakhir. Hal ini terjadi karena adanya kerusuhan yang berkembang di Hong Kong.Protes pro-demokrasi di Hong Kong yang telah berlangsung selama berbulan-bulan ini memaksa toko-toko tutup, melumpuhkan transportasi umum, dan membuat takut para wisatawan. Hal ini membuat perekonomian Hong Kong jatuh dalam kondisi yang lebih buruk dan mendorong investor serta perusahaan untuk memindahkan uang mereka ke tempat lain.Melansir dari CNBC, Senin (4/11/2019), Singapura dikatakan sebagai penerima keuntungan dari imbas kerusuhan di Hong Kong. Dalam sebuah perkiraan, perusahaan perbankan Goldman Sachs telah mengatakan bahwa Hong Kong mungkin telah kehilangan US$ 4 miliar atau sekitar Rp 56 triliun dalam bentuk deposit ke Singapura."Kita tidak dapat meyakinkan bahwa ada pergeseran dari Hong Kong ke Singapura. Tapi ya, dalam sistem perbankan Singapura - setoran FX telah naik cukup tajam dalam dua, tiga bulan terakhir," kata Wakil Kepala Asia untuk riset keuangan J.P. Morgan Harsh Modi kepada CNBC.Meski banyak investor dan perusahaan yang telah memindahkan depositnya dari Hong Kong ke Singapura, Harsh mengatakan kalau ia masih memiliki kekhawatiran. Hal ini dikarenakan banyaknya bank-bank Singapura yang memiliki aset di Hong Kong. Ditakutkan banyak bank Singapura dapat mengalami kredit macet dari entitas mereka di Hong Kong."Kekhawatiran terbesar kami di bank-bank Singapura adalah bisnis kualitas aset Hong Kong," katanya.Harsh Modi mengatakan kalau dari tiga pemberi pinjaman terbesar di Singapura, dia lebih positif terhadap United Overseas Bank, yang memiliki paling sedikit aset di Hong Kong, dibanding DBS Bank dan OCBC Bank yang memiliki ritel di Hong Kong. Hong Kong Demo Makes Investors Run to Singapore
Nov. 04, 2019, 07:11 by Ignacio Geordi Oswaldo


Photo: AP Photo / Vincent Yu

Jakarta - J.P.'s asset management company Morgan said that deposits of foreign exchange deposits to Singapore banks have increased rapidly in recent months. This happened because of the riots that developed in Hong Kong. Pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong that have been going on for months have forced shops to close, stifle public transportation, and frighten tourists. This makes the economy of Hong Kong fall in worse conditions and encourage investors and companies to move their money elsewhere. Launching from CNBC, Monday (11/04/2019), Singapore is said to be the beneficiary of the impact of the riots in Hong Kong. In an estimate, the banking company Goldman Sachs has said that Hong Kong may have lost US $ 4 billion or around Rp. 56 trillion in deposits to Singapore. "We cannot be sure that there is a shift from Hong Kong to Singapore. But yes, in the system Singapore banking - FX deposits have risen quite sharply in the last two, three months, "said Deputy Asia Head for JP financial research Morgan Harsh Modi told CNBC. Although many investors and companies have moved their deposits from Hong Kong to Singapore, Harsh said he still had concerns. This is because many Singapore banks have assets in Hong Kong. It is feared that many Singapore banks could experience bad credit from their entities in Hong Kong. "Our biggest concern at Singapore banks is the Hong Kong asset quality business," he said. Hay Modi said that of the three largest lenders in Singapore, he was more positive about United Overseas Bank, which has the least assets in Hong Kong, compared to DBS Bank and OCBC Bank which has retail in Hong Kong.
